newsitem.title: UK: UK's Blair leads tributes to Goldsmith.
newsitem.headline: UK's Blair leads tributes to Goldsmith.

text.p: British Prime Minister Tony Blair on Saturday led a string of fulsome tributes to the Anglo-French entrepreneur Sir James Goldsmith who died aged 64 after a long battle with cancer.

"He was an extraordinary character and though I didn't always agree with his political views, obviously he was an amazing and interesting and fascinating man and I think people will miss him," Blair said.
Former prime minister Margaret Thatcher said: "Jimmy Goldsmith was one of the most powerful and dynamic personalities that this generation has seen.
"He was enormously generous and fiercely loyal to the causes he espoused. He was a good friend and I am saddened by his loss."

Fellow tycoon and long-time friend Peter de Savary, who stood as a candidate for Goldsmith's Referendum Party at the last British general election, said: "He had courage, ability, determination, kindness.
"I am very saddened. He had the ability to climb the mountain and come down safely on the other side."
